headline: Japan's PM Sanae Takaichi set to win big in snap legislative elections
description: Polls show the Liberal Democratic Party (PLD) of Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi on course for a decisive victory in the February 8 legislative elections.

headline: Epstein scandal prompts Jack Lang to offer resignation as head of the World Arab Institute
Trump shares racist video depicting the Obamas as monkeys, leaving White House scrambling
The stigma that surrounds 'slut shaming' persists
description: Maïa Mazaurette, a columnist at Le Monde, reviews 'Slut Shaming,' the latest book from Ovidie. The writer traces the fallout from the 'porno chic' movement, an era when transgression ruled, while also warning against the 'sex-positive' feminism that followed.

headline: French companies cut down on drinking at work
description: Abstinence is gaining traction in France, including among employers. The electric utility company EDF banned alcohol consumption on all sites, prompting internal protest.

headline: Robert Crumb, comic book author: 'I am a paranoid person and I make fun of that'
description: In 'Tales of Paranoia,' the legend of American counterculture comics takes readers on a dizzying journey into the world of madness, illustrated with a case study: Robert Crumb.

headline: 'Heated Rivalry': Star-crossed love between two ice hockey players
description: The series, which has enjoyed massive success in Canada, brings a gay romance to the traditionally masculine world of ice hockey.

headline: Washington Post CEO Will Lewis exits after drastic job cuts: 'Right time for me to step aside'

2026 Olympics Figure Skating: Russia ban opens up team event like never before
In Syria's Roj detention camp, jihadist women are convinced they will soon be 'freed'
Director of France's Museum of Immigration History: 'Fraternity has played a much greater role in our history than surges of xenophobia'
Bad Bunny, the anti-Trump icon made in Puerto Rico
description: On Sunday, in front of tens of millions of television viewers, the Puerto Rican reggaeton phenomenon will headline the Super Bowl halftime show, on the heels of winning Album of the Year at the Grammys. But, at a time when the ruthless crackdown on undocumented immigrants is raging in the US, inviting this Latin icon to one of America's major events was always bound to anger Donald Trump.

headline: Iranian photojournalist shares unseen images of Tehran protests
description: Images that capture the scale of the brutally suppressed protests that swept Iran between December 28 and January 11 are rare. Some NGOs report at least 18,000 people dead. Iranian photographer Yalda Moaiery managed to transmit her images of the January 8 demonstrations and the funeral of a man killed by the regime.

headline: Jeffrey Epstein's business ties with banker Ariane de Rothschild revealed
description: The latest release of the Epstein files by the US Department of Justice has confirmed the extremely close relationship between the French-German head of the Edmond de Rothschild group and the convicted sex offender. From 2013 until his death in 2019, he acted as an unofficial adviser to the Switzerland-based bank.

headline: Epstein scandal tarnishes former minister Jack Lang and France's image
'In the US, Christian nationalism contributes to the dismantling of democracy'
'Not only is Trump not crazy, but he is dangerous': Historian Laure Murat salutes Minneapolis 'lesson in democracy'
